intro: Enterospermum coriaceum, commonly known as the rough enterosperm, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or red, with five petals and numerous stamens. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
